channel.title: Data Science Portfolio on Stephen Gelinas
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science Portfolio on Stephen Gelinas

item.title: WallStreetBets Sentiment Analyzer
item.description: Trained VADER Sentiment Analyzer on WallStreeBets comments from 2021 to analyze how positive, neutral, and negative sentiment changes over time. Pulled market data to determine how the S&P500 closing price correlates with WallStreetBets sentiment. Trained a classifier to predict if the S&P500 will close with a daily percent gain or loss using WallStreeBets sentiment and post data. Identified common words in WallStreetBets with bullish/berish sentiment to add to VADER lexicon to improve classifier’s performance.

item.title: Uber/Lyft Price Predictor
item.description: Created a tool that estimates the price of an Uber/Lyft ride in Boston, MA (RMSE = .09, r2 = .89). Log transformed estimated price to reduce sknewness and improve model performance. Determined feature importance and used principle component analysis to reduce colinearity. Optimized a Decision Tree Regressor using GridSearchCV to find the best model parameters (RMSE = .01, r2 = .94). Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: NYPD Complaint Outcome Classifier
item.description: Created a tool that classifies if an NYPD police officer was disciplined from a complaint. Determined the most important features for classifying the complaint outcome. Used principal component analysis to reduce the number of categorical features. Optimized a Random Forest Classifier using GridSearchCV to find optimal parameters. (testing accuracy = 76.2%). Evaluated model fairness by testing if classifier performance differs in determining board disposition of cops with the title ‘Police Officer’ and cops with all other titles.
